testcase.author: SecureSoftware
testcase.description: If one extends a signed number incorrectly, if negative numbers are used, an incorrect extension may result. (from TCCLASP-5_2_10_10)

testcase.author: SecureSoftware
testcase.description: An unsigned-to-signed conversion error takes place when a large unsignedprimitive is used as an signed value - usually as a size variable. (from TCCLASP-5_2_12_10)[br][br]Duplicate code of Test Case 19

flaw.name: CWE-118: Improper Access of Indexable Resource ('Range Error')

testcase.author: SecureSoftware
testcase.description: Miscalculated null termination occurs when the placement of a null character at the end of a buffer of characters (or string) is misplaced or omitted. (from TCCLASP-5_2_14_9)

testcase.author: SecureSoftware
testcase.description: Improper string length checking takes place when wide or multi-byte character strings are mistaken for standard character strings. (from TCCLASP-5_2_15_10)

testcase.author: MIT
testcase.description:
Buffer Overflow. This code has been donated by MIT. This test case has the following characteristics :

write/read = Write,
Which bound = Upper,
Data type = character,
Memory location = stack,
Scope = same,
Container = no,
Pointer = no,
Index complexity = constant,
Address complexity = constant,
Length complexity = N/A,
Address alias = no,
Index alias = none,
Local control flow = switch,
Secondary control flow = none,
Loop structure = N/A,
Loop complexity = no,
Asynchrony = no,
Taint = no,
Runtime env. dependence = none,
Magnitude = discrete,
Continuous/discrete = discrete,
Signedness = no.

testcase.author: MIT
testcase.description:
SIG-BUG: CA-1999-14. From MIT benchmarks (models/bind/b2)

A buffer overflow caused by improper handling of SIG records

Bad file: sig-bad.c
Bad line number: 561

Taxonomy classification : 0060301212004

flaw.name: CWE-119: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

testcase.author: MIT
testcase.description:
SIG-BUG: CA-1999-14. Patched version. From MIT benchmarks (models/bind/b2)

A buffer overflow caused by improper handling of SIG records

Patched file: sig-ok.c
Patched line number: 538

fix.name: CWE-119: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

testcase.author: MIT
testcase.description:
NXT-BUG: CA-1999-14. From MIT benchmarks (models/bind/b1)

A buffer overflow in memcpy function in the code handling NXT resource records.

Bad file: nxt-bad.c
Bad line number: 405

Taxonomy classification : 0060301212004

flaw.name: CWE-119: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

testcase.description:
CWE: 114 Process Control
BadSource: relativePath Hard code the relative pathname to the library
GoodSource: Hard code the full pathname to the library
Sink:
BadSink : Load a dynamic link library
Flow Variant: 05 Control flow: if(static_t) and if(static_f)

CWE: 114 Process Control
BadSource: relativePath Hard code the relative pathname to the library
GoodSource: Hard code the full pathname to the library
Sink:
BadSink : Load a dynamic link library
Flow Variant: 06 Control flow: if(static_const_five==5) and if(static_const_five!=5)

CWE: 114 Process Control
BadSource: relativePath Hard code the relative pathname to the library
GoodSource: Hard code the full pathname to the library
Sink:
BadSink : Load a dynamic link library
Flow Variant: 07 Control flow: if(static_five==5) and if(static_five!=5)

testcase.author: Fortify Software
testcase.description: Tainted input allows arbitrary files to be read and written.

testcase.author: Fortify Software
testcase.description: Tainted input allows arbitrary files to be read and written. (fixed version)

testcase.author: Fortify Software
testcase.description: Two file operations are performed on a filename, allowing a filename race condition to occur.

flaw.name: CWE-362: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
CWE-362: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
CWE-362: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')

testcase.author: Fortify Software
testcase.description: Printf is called with a user supplied format string.

testcase.author: Fortify Software
testcase.description: Printf is called with a programmer supplied format string.

testcase.author: Fortify Software
testcase.description: Syslog is called with a user supplied format string.

testcase.author: Toyota ITC
testcase.description:
Defect Type: Numerical defects
Defect Sub-type: Bit shift bigger than integral type or negative
Description: Defect Code to identify bit shift errors

testcase.author: Toyota ITC
testcase.description:
Defect Type: Numerical defects
Defect Sub-type: Bit shift bigger than integral type or negative
Description: Defect Free Code to identify false positives in bit shift errors

testcase.author: Toyota ITC
testcase.description:
Defect Type: Dynamic memory defects
Defect Sub-type: Dynamic buffer overrun
Created on: Sep 27, 2012
Author: caesaru01

The test case contains coincidental vulnerabilities among with intended ones as follows for file buffer_overrun_dynamic.c:
* line(s): 145,151,153,173,434,511,513,550,558 CWE-476
* line(s): 332 CWE-121
* line(s): 476,492 CWE-704
* line(s): 495 CWE-468
* line(s): 606 CWE-823

flaw.name: CWE-704: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast
CWE-823: Use of Out-of-range Pointer Offset
CWE-704: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast

testcase.author: Bolo -- Josef T. Burger
testcase.description: CVE-2014-0160: This is "heartbit", a redacted version of the portions of openssl-1.0.1f that cause the now infamous "heartbleed" exploit to expose private memory of any process running a exploitable version of openssl. It easily compiles & runs on many current unix / linux boxes, including cygwin on win32. Source: https://www.mir-swamp.org/#resources/heartbit

flaw.name: CWE-119: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
